metadata.Title: CVE-2016-8859 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Multiple integer overflows in the TRE library and musl libc allow attackers to cause memory corruption via a large number of (1) states or (2) tags, which triggers an out-of-bounds write.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2016-8859` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

musl - 1.1.19-2
musl-tools - 1.1.19-2
No subscription required

libtre5 - 0.8.0-6
tre-agrep - 0.8.0-6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: musl package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.1.19-2').
tre package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.8.0-6').
